rdfs:label: Roof
dc:description: A roof is the covering on the uppermost part of a building which provides protection from animals and weather, notably rain, but also heat, wind and sunlight.

rdfs:label: Room
dc:description: An area within a building enclosed by walls and floor and ceiling.

rdfs:label: Clothing
dc:description: A covering designed to be worn on the body.

rdfs:label: Device
dc:description: An object contrived for a specific purpose.

rdfs:label: Assistive-device
dc:description: A device that help an individual accomplish a task.

rdfs:label: Glasses
dc:description: Frames with lenses worn in front of the eye for vision correction, eye protection, or protection from UV rays.

rdfs:label: Writing-device
dc:description: A device used for writing.

rdfs:label: Pen
dc:description: A common writing instrument used to apply ink to a surface for writing or drawing.

rdfs:label: Pencil
dc:description: An implement for writing or drawing that is constructed of a narrow solid pigment core in a protective casing that prevents the core from being broken or marking the hand.

rdfs:label: Computing-device
dc:description: An electronic device which take inputs and processes results from the inputs.

rdfs:label: Cellphone
dc:description: A telephone with access to a cellular radio system so it can be used over a wide area, without a physical connection to a network.

rdfs:label: Desktop-computer
dc:description: A computer suitable for use at an ordinary desk.

rdfs:label: Laptop-computer
dc:description: A computer that is portable and suitable for use while traveling.

rdfs:label: Tablet-computer
dc:description: A small portable computer that accepts input directly on to its screen rather than via a keyboard or mouse.

rdfs:label: Engine
dc:description: A motor is a machine designed to convert one or more forms of energy into mechanical energy.

rdfs:label: IO-device
dc:description: Hardware used by a human (or other system) to communicate with a computer.

rdfs:label: Input-device
dc:description: A piece of equipment used to provide data and control signals to an information processing system such as a computer or information appliance.

rdfs:label: Computer-mouse
dc:description: A hand-held pointing device that detects two-dimensional motion relative to a surface.

rdfs:label: Mouse-button
dc:description: An electric switch on a computer mouse which can be pressed or clicked to select or interact with an element of a graphical user interface.

rdfs:label: Scroll-wheel
dc:description: A scroll wheel or mouse wheel is a wheel used for scrolling made of hard plastic with a rubbery surface usually located between the left and right mouse buttons and is positioned perpendicular to the mouse surface.

rdfs:label: Joystick
dc:description: A control device that uses a movable handle to create two-axis input for a computer device.

rdfs:label: Keyboard
dc:description: A device consisting of mechanical keys that are pressed to create input to a computer.

rdfs:label: Keyboard-key
dc:description: A button on a keyboard usually representing letters, numbers, functions, or symbols.

rdfs:label: Keyboard-key-#
dc:description: Value of a keyboard key.

rdfs:label: Keypad
dc:description: A device consisting of keys, usually in a block arrangement, that provides limited input to a system.

rdfs:label: Keypad-key
dc:description: A key on a separate section of a computer keyboard that groups together numeric keys and those for mathematical or other special functions in an arrangement like that of a calculator.

rdfs:label: Keypad-key-#
dc:description: Value of keypad key.

rdfs:label: Microphone
dc:description: A device designed to convert sound to an electrical signal.

rdfs:label: Push-button
dc:description: A switch designed to be operated by pressing a button.

rdfs:label: Output-device
dc:description: Any piece of computer hardware equipment which converts information into human understandable form.

rdfs:label: Auditory-device
dc:description: A device designed to produce sound.

rdfs:label: Headphones
dc:description: An instrument that consists of a pair of small loudspeakers, or less commonly a single speaker, held close to ears and connected to a signal source such as an audio amplifier, radio, CD player or portable media player.

rdfs:label: Loudspeaker
dc:description: A device designed to convert electrical signals to sounds that can be heard.

rdfs:label: Display-device
dc:description: An output device for presentation of information in visual or tactile form the latter used for example in tactile electronic displays for blind people.

rdfs:label: Computer-screen
dc:description: An electronic device designed as a display or a physical device designed to be a protective meshwork.

rdfs:label: Screen-window
dc:description: A part of a computer screen that contains a display different from the rest of the screen. A window is a graphical control element consisting of a visual area containing some of the graphical user interface of the program it belongs to and is framed by a window decoration.

rdfs:label: Head-mounted-display
dc:description: An instrument that functions as a display device, worn on the head or as part of a helmet, that has a small display optic in front of one (monocular HMD) or each eye (binocular HMD).

rdfs:label: LED-display
dc:description: A LED display is a flat panel display that uses an array of light-emitting diodes as pixels for a video display.

rdfs:label: Recording-device
dc:description: A device that copies information in a signal into a persistent information bearer.

rdfs:label: EEG-recorder
dc:description: A device for recording electric currents in the brain using electrodes applied to the scalp, to the surface of the brain, or placed within the substance of the brain.

rdfs:label: File-storage
dc:description: A device for recording digital information to a permanent media.

rdfs:label: MEG-recorder
dc:description: A device for measuring the magnetic fields produced by electrical activity in the brain, usually conducted externally.

rdfs:label: Motion-capture
dc:description: A device for recording the movement of objects or people.

rdfs:label: Tape-recorder
dc:description: A device for recording and reproduction usually using magnetic tape for storage that can be saved and played back.

rdfs:label: Touchscreen
dc:description: A control component that operates an electronic device by pressing the display on the screen.

rdfs:label: Machine
dc:description: A human-made device that uses power to apply forces and control movement to perform an action.

rdfs:label: Measurement-device
dc:description: A device in which a measure function inheres.

rdfs:label: Clock
dc:description: A device designed to indicate the time of day or to measure the time duration of an event or action.

rdfs:label: Clock-face
dc:description: A location identifier based on clockface numbering or anatomic subregion.

rdfs:label: Robot
dc:description: A mechanical device that sometimes resembles a living animal and is capable of performing a variety of often complex human tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.

rdfs:label: Tool
dc:description: A component that is not part of a device but is designed to support its assemby or operation.

rdfs:label: Document
dc:description: A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.

rdfs:label: Book
dc:description: A volume made up of pages fastened along one edge and enclosed between protective covers.

rdfs:label: Letter
dc:description: A written message addressed to a person or organization.

rdfs:label: Note
dc:description: A brief written record.

rdfs:label: Notebook
dc:description: A book for notes or memoranda.

rdfs:label: Questionnaire
dc:description: A document consisting of questions and possibly responses, depending on whether it has been filled out.

rdfs:label: Furnishing
dc:description: Furniture, fittings, and other decorative accessories, such as curtains and carpets, for a house or room.

rdfs:label: Manufactured-material
dc:description: Substances created or extracted from raw materials.

rdfs:label: Ceramic
dc:description: A hard, brittle, heat-resistant and corrosion-resistant material made by shaping and then firing a nonmetallic mineral, such as clay, at a high temperature.

rdfs:label: Glass
dc:description: A brittle transparent solid with irregular atomic structure.

rdfs:label: Paper
dc:description: A thin sheet material produced by mechanically or chemically processing cellulose fibres derived from wood, rags, grasses or other vegetable sources in water.

rdfs:label: Plastic
dc:description: Various high-molecular-weight thermoplastic or thermosetting polymers that are capable of being molded, extruded, drawn, or otherwise shaped and then hardened into a form.

rdfs:label: Steel
dc:description: An alloy made up of iron with typically a few tenths of a percent of carbon to improve its strength and fracture resistance compared to iron.

rdfs:label: Media
dc:description: Media are audo/visual/audiovisual modes of communicating information for mass consumption.

rdfs:label: Media-clip
dc:description: A short segment of media.

rdfs:label: Audio-clip
dc:description: A short segment of audio.

rdfs:label: Audiovisual-clip
dc:description: A short media segment containing both audio and video.

rdfs:label: Video-clip
dc:description: A short segment of video.

rdfs:label: Visualization
dc:description: An planned process that creates images, diagrams or animations from the input data.

rdfs:label: Animation
dc:description: A form of graphical illustration that changes with time to give a sense of motion or represent dynamic changes in the portrayal.

rdfs:label: Art-installation
dc:description: A large-scale, mixed-media constructions, often designed for a specific place or for a temporary period of time.

rdfs:label: Braille
dc:description: A display using a system of raised dots that can be read with the fingers by people who are blind.

rdfs:label: Image
dc:description: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

rdfs:label: Cartoon
dc:description: A type of illustration, sometimes animated, typically in a non-realistic or semi-realistic style. The specific meaning has evolved over time, but the modern usage usually refers to either an image or series of images intended for satire, caricature, or humor. A motion picture that relies on a sequence of illustrations for its animation.

rdfs:label: Drawing
dc:description: A representation of an object or outlining a figure, plan, or sketch by means of lines.

rdfs:label: Icon
dc:description: A sign (such as a word or graphic symbol) whose form suggests its meaning.

rdfs:label: Painting
dc:description: A work produced through the art of painting.

rdfs:label: Photograph
dc:description: An image recorded by a camera.

rdfs:label: Movie
dc:description: A sequence of images displayed in succession giving the illusion of continuous movement.

rdfs:label: Outline-visualization
dc:description: A visualization consisting of a line or set of lines enclosing or indicating the shape of an object in a sketch or diagram.

rdfs:label: Point-light-visualization
dc:description: A display in which action is depicted using a few points of light, often generated from discrete sensors in motion capture.

rdfs:label: Sculpture
dc:description: A two- or three-dimensional representative or abstract forms, especially by carving stone or wood or by casting metal or plaster.

rdfs:label: Stick-figure-visualization
dc:description: A drawing showing the head of a human being or animal as a circle and all other parts as straight lines.

rdfs:label: Navigational-object
dc:description: An object whose purpose is to assist directed movement from one location to another.

rdfs:label: Path
dc:description: A trodden way. A way or track laid down for walking or made by continual treading.

rdfs:label: Road
dc:description: An open way for the passage of vehicles, persons, or animals on land.

rdfs:label: Lane
dc:description: A defined path with physical dimensions through which an object or substance may traverse.

rdfs:label: Runway
dc:description: A paved strip of ground on a landing field for the landing and takeoff of aircraft.

rdfs:label: Vehicle
dc:description: A mobile machine which transports people or cargo.

rdfs:label: Aircraft
dc:description: A vehicle which is able to travel through air in an atmosphere.

rdfs:label: Bicycle
dc:description: A human-powered, pedal-driven, single-track vehicle, having two wheels attached to a frame, one behind the other.

rdfs:label: Boat
dc:description: A watercraft of any size which is able to float or plane on water.

rdfs:label: Car
dc:description: A wheeled motor vehicle used primarily for the transportation of human passengers.

rdfs:label: Cart
dc:description: A cart is a vehicle which has two wheels and is designed to transport human passengers or cargo.

rdfs:label: Tractor
dc:description: A mobile machine specifically designed to deliver a high tractive effort at slow speeds, and mainly used for the purposes of hauling a trailer or machinery used in agriculture or construction.

rdfs:label: Train
dc:description: A connected line of railroad cars with or without a locomotive.

rdfs:label: Truck
dc:description: A motor vehicle which, as its primary funcion, transports cargo rather than human passangers.

rdfs:label: Natural-object
dc:description: Something that exists in or is produced by nature, and is not artificial or man-made.

rdfs:label: Mineral
dc:description: A solid, homogeneous, inorganic substance occurring in nature and having a definite chemical composition.

rdfs:label: Natural-feature
dc:description: A feature that occurs in nature. A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.

rdfs:label: Field
dc:description: An unbroken expanse as of ice or grassland.

rdfs:label: Hill
dc:description: A rounded elevation of limited extent rising above the surrounding land with local relief of less than 300m.

rdfs:label: Mountain
dc:description: A landform that extends above the surrounding terrain in a limited area.

rdfs:label: River
dc:description: A natural freshwater surface stream of considerable volume and a permanent or seasonal flow, moving in a definite channel toward a sea, lake, or another river.

rdfs:label: Waterfall
dc:description: A sudden descent of water over a step or ledge in the bed of a river.

rdfs:label: Sound
dc:description: Mechanical vibrations transmitted by an elastic medium. Something that can be heard.

rdfs:label: Environmental-sound
dc:description: Sounds occuring in the environment. An accumulation of noise pollution that occurs outside. This noise can be caused by transport, industrial, and recreational activities.

rdfs:label: Crowd-sound
dc:description: Noise produced by a mixture of sounds from a large group of people.

rdfs:label: Signal-noise
dc:description: Any part of a signal that is not the true or original signal but is introduced by the communication mechanism.

rdfs:label: Musical-sound
dc:description: Sound produced by continuous and regular vibrations, as opposed to noise.

rdfs:label: Instrument-sound
dc:description: Sound produced by a musical instrument.

rdfs:label: Tone
dc:description: A musical note, warble, or other sound used as a particular signal on a telephone or answering machine.

rdfs:label: Vocalized-sound
dc:description: Musical sound produced by vocal cords in a biological agent.

rdfs:label: Named-animal-sound
dc:description: A sound recognizable as being associated with particular animals.

rdfs:label: Barking
dc:description: Sharp explosive cries like sounds made by certain animals, especially a dog, fox, or seal.

rdfs:label: Bleating
dc:description: Wavering cries like sounds made by a sheep, goat, or calf.

rdfs:label: Chirping
dc:description: Short, sharp, high-pitched noises like sounds made by small birds or an insects.

rdfs:label: Crowing
dc:description: Loud shrill sounds characteristic of roosters.

rdfs:label: Growling
dc:description: Low guttural sounds like those that made in the throat by a hostile dog or other animal.

rdfs:label: Meowing
dc:description: Vocalizations like those made by as those cats. These sounds have diverse tones and are sometimes chattered, murmured or whispered. The purpose can be assertive.

rdfs:label: Mooing
dc:description: Deep vocal sounds like those made by a cow.

rdfs:label: Purring
dc:description: Low continuous vibratory sound such as those made by cats. The sound expresses contentment.

rdfs:label: Roaring
dc:description: Loud, deep, or harsh prolonged sounds such as those made by big cats and bears for long-distance communication and intimidation.

rdfs:label: Squawking
dc:description: Loud, harsh noises such as those made by geese.

rdfs:label: Named-object-sound
dc:description: A sound identifiable as coming from a particular type of object.

rdfs:label: Alarm-sound
dc:description: A loud signal often loud continuous ringing to alert people to a problem or condition that requires urgent attention.

rdfs:label: Beep
dc:description: A short, single tone, that is typically high-pitched and generally made by a computer or other machine.

rdfs:label: Buzz
dc:description: A persistent vibratory sound often made by a buzzer device and used to indicate something incorrect.

rdfs:label: Click
dc:description: The sound made by a mechanical cash register, often to designate a reward.

rdfs:label: Ding
dc:description: A short ringing sound such as that made by a bell, often to indicate a correct response or the expiration of time.

rdfs:label: Horn-blow
dc:description: A loud sound made by forcing air through a sound device that funnels air to create the sound, often used to sound an alert.

rdfs:label: Ka-ching
dc:description: The sound made by a mechanical cash register, often to designate a reward.

rdfs:label: Siren
dc:description: A loud, continuous sound often varying in frequency designed to indicate an emergency.

rdfs:label: Property
dc:description: Something that pertains to a thing. A characteristic of some entity. A quality or feature regarded as a characteristic or inherent part of someone or something. HED attributes are adjectives or adverbs.

rdfs:label: Agent-property
dc:description: Something that pertains to an agent.

rdfs:label: Agent-state
dc:description: The state of the agent.

rdfs:label: Agent-cognitive-state
dc:description: The state of the cognitive processes or state of mind of the agent.

rdfs:label: Alert
dc:description: Condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action.

rdfs:label: Anesthetized
dc:description: Having lost sensation to pain or having senses dulled due to the effects of an anesthetic.

rdfs:label: Asleep
dc:description: Having entered a periodic, readily reversible state of reduced awareness and metabolic activity, usually accompanied by physical relaxation and brain activity.

rdfs:label: Attentive
dc:description: Concentrating and focusing mental energy on the task or surroundings.

rdfs:label: Awake
dc:description: In a non sleeping state.

rdfs:label: Brain-dead
dc:description: Characterized by the irreversible absence of cortical and brain stem functioning.

rdfs:label: Comatose
dc:description: In a state of profound unconsciousness associated with markedly depressed cerebral activity.

rdfs:label: Distracted
dc:description: Lacking in concentration because of being preoccupied.

rdfs:label: Drowsy
dc:description: In a state of near-sleep, a strong desire for sleep, or sleeping for unusually long periods.

rdfs:label: Intoxicated
dc:description: In a state with disturbed psychophysiological functions and responses as a result of administration or ingestion of a psychoactive substance.

rdfs:label: Locked-in
dc:description: In a state of complete paralysis of all voluntary muscles except for the ones that control the movements of the eyes.

rdfs:label: Passive
dc:description: Not responding or initiating an action in response to a stimulus.

rdfs:label: Resting
dc:description: A state in which the agent is not exhibiting any physical exertion.

rdfs:label: Vegetative
dc:description: A state of wakefulness and conscience, but (in contrast to coma) with involuntary opening of the eyes and movements (such as teeth grinding, yawning, or thrashing of the extremities).

rdfs:label: Agent-emotional-state
dc:description: The status of the general temperament and outlook of an agent.

rdfs:label: Angry
dc:description: Experiencing emotions characterized by marked annoyance or hostility.

rdfs:label: Aroused
dc:description: In a state reactive to stimuli leading to increased heart rate and blood pressure, sensory alertness, mobility and readiness to respond.

rdfs:label: Awed
dc:description: Filled with wonder. Feeling grand, sublime or powerful emotions characterized by a combination of joy, fear, admiration, reverence, and/or respect.

rdfs:label: Compassionate
dc:description: Feeling or showing sympathy and concern for others often evoked for a person who is in distress and associated with altruistic motivation.

rdfs:label: Content
dc:description: Feeling  satisfaction with things as they are.

rdfs:label: Disgusted
dc:description: Feeling revulsion or profound disapproval aroused by something unpleasant or offensive.

rdfs:label: Emotionally-neutral
dc:description: Feeling neither satisfied nor dissatisfied.

rdfs:label: Empathetic
dc:description: Understanding and sharing the feelings of another. Being aware of, being sensitive to, and vicariously experiencing the feelings, thoughts, and experience of another.

rdfs:label: Excited
dc:description: Feeling great enthusiasm and eagerness.

rdfs:label: Fearful
dc:description: Feeling apprehension that one may be in danger.

rdfs:label: Frustrated
dc:description: Feeling annoyed as a result of being blocked, thwarted, disappointed or defeated.

rdfs:label: Grieving
dc:description: Feeling sorrow in response to loss, whether physical or abstract.

rdfs:label: Happy
dc:description: Feeling pleased and content.

rdfs:label: Jealous
dc:description: Feeling threatened by a rival in a relationship with another individual, in particular an intimate partner, usually involves feelings of threat, fear, suspicion, distrust, anxiety, anger, betrayal, and rejection.

rdfs:label: Joyful
dc:description: Feeling delight or intense happiness.

rdfs:label: Loving
dc:description: Feeling a strong positive emotion of affection and attraction.

rdfs:label: Relieved
dc:description: No longer feeling pain, distress,  anxiety, or reassured.

rdfs:label: Sad
dc:description: Feeling grief or unhappiness.

rdfs:label: Stressed
dc:description: Experiencing mental or emotional strain or tension.

rdfs:label: Agent-physiological-state
dc:description: Having to do with the mechanical, physical, or biochemical function of an agent.

rdfs:label: Healthy
dc:description: Having no significant health-related issues.

rdfs:label: Hungry
dc:description: Being in a state of craving or desiring food.

rdfs:label: Rested
dc:description: Feeling refreshed and relaxed.

rdfs:label: Sated
dc:description: Feeling full.

rdfs:label: Sick
dc:description: Being in a state of ill health, bodily malfunction, or discomfort.

rdfs:label: Thirsty
dc:description: Feeling a need to drink.

rdfs:label: Tired
dc:description: Feeling in need of sleep or rest.

rdfs:label: Agent-postural-state
dc:description: Pertaining to the position in which agent holds their body.

rdfs:label: Crouching
dc:description: Adopting a position where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down, sometimes to avoid detection or to defend oneself.

rdfs:label: Eyes-closed
dc:description: Keeping eyes closed with no blinking.

rdfs:label: Eyes-open
dc:description: Keeping eyes open with occasional blinking.

rdfs:label: Kneeling
dc:description: Positioned where one or both knees are on the ground.

rdfs:label: On-treadmill
dc:description: Ambulation on an exercise apparatus with an endless moving belt to support moving in place.

rdfs:label: Prone
dc:description: Positioned in a recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its stomach and faces downward.

rdfs:label: Seated-with-chin-rest
dc:description: Using a device that supports the chin and head.

rdfs:label: Sitting
dc:description: In a seated position.

rdfs:label: Standing
dc:description: Assuming or maintaining an erect upright position.

rdfs:label: Agent-task-role
dc:description: The function or part that is ascribed to an agent in performing the task.

rdfs:label: Experiment-actor
dc:description: An agent who plays a predetermined role to create the experiment scenario.

rdfs:label: Experiment-controller
dc:description: An agent exerting control over some aspect of the experiment.

rdfs:label: Experiment-participant
dc:description: Someone who takes part in an activity related to an experiment.

rdfs:label: Experimenter
dc:description: Person who is the owner of the experiment and has its responsibility.

rdfs:label: Agent-trait
dc:description: A genetically, environmentally, or socially determined characteristic of an agent.

rdfs:label: Age
dc:description: Length of time elapsed time since birth of the agent.

rdfs:label: Agent-experience-level
dc:description: Amount of skill or knowledge that the agent has as pertains to the task.

rdfs:label: Expert-level
dc:description: Having comprehensive and authoritative knowledge of or skill in a particular area related to the task.

rdfs:label: Intermediate-experience-level
dc:description: Having a moderate amount of knowledge or skill related to the task.

rdfs:label: Novice-level
dc:description: Being inexperienced in a field or situation related to the task.

rdfs:label: Ethnicity
dc:description: Belong to a social group that has a common national or cultural tradition. Use with Label to avoid extension.

rdfs:label: Gender
dc:description: Characteristics that are socially constructed, including norms, behaviors, and roles based on sex.

rdfs:label: Handedness
dc:description: Individual preference for use of a hand, known as the dominant hand.

rdfs:label: Ambidextrous
dc:description: Having no overall dominance in the use of right or left hand or foot in the performance of tasks that require one hand or foot.

rdfs:label: Left-handed
dc:description: Preference for using the left hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot.

rdfs:label: Right-handed
dc:description: Preference for using the right hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot.

rdfs:label: Race
dc:description: Belonging to a group sharing physical or social qualities as defined within a specified society. Use with Label to avoid extension.

rdfs:label: Sex
dc:description: Physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female.

rdfs:label: Female
dc:description: Biological sex of an individual with female sexual organs such ova.

rdfs:label: Intersex
dc:description: Having genitalia and/or secondary sexual characteristics of indeterminate sex.

rdfs:label: Male
dc:description: Biological sex of an individual with male sexual organs producing sperm.

rdfs:label: Data-property
dc:description: Something that pertains to data or information.

rdfs:label: Data-marker
dc:description: An indicator placed to mark something.

rdfs:label: Data-break-marker
dc:description: An indicator place to indicate a gap in the data.

rdfs:label: Temporal-marker
dc:description: An indicator placed at a particular time in the data.

rdfs:label: Inset
dc:description: Marks an intermediate point in an ongoing event of temporal extent.

rdfs:label: Offset
dc:description: Marks the end of an event of temporal extent.

rdfs:label: Onset
dc:description: Marks the start of an ongoing event of temporal extent.

rdfs:label: Pause
dc:description: Indicates the temporary interruption of  the operation a process and subsequently wait for a signal to continue.

rdfs:label: Time-out
dc:description: A cancellation or cessation that automatically occurs when a predefined interval of time has passed without a certain event occurring.

rdfs:label: Time-sync
dc:description: A synchronization signal whose purpose to help synchronize different signals or processes. Often used to indicate a marker inserted into the recorded data to allow post hoc synchronization of concurrently recorded data streams.

rdfs:label: Data-resolution
dc:description: Smallest change in a quality being measured by an sensor that causes a perceptible change.

rdfs:label: Printer-resolution
dc:description: Resolution of a printer, usually expressed as the number of dots-per-inch for a printer.

rdfs:label: Screen-resolution
dc:description: Resolution of a screen, usually expressed as the of pixels in a dimension for a digital display device.

rdfs:label: Sensory-resolution
dc:description: Resolution of measurements by a sensing device.

rdfs:label: Spatial-resolution
dc:description: Linear spacing of a spatial measurement.

rdfs:label: Spectral-resolution
dc:description: Measures the ability of a sensor to  resolve features in the electromagnetic spectrum.

rdfs:label: Temporal-resolution
dc:description: Measures the ability of a sensor to  resolve features in time.

rdfs:label: Data-source-type
dc:description: The type of place, person, or thing from which the data comes or can be obtained.

rdfs:label: Computed-feature
dc:description: A feature computed from the data by a tool. This tag should be grouped with a label of the form Toolname_propertyName.

rdfs:label: Computed-prediction
dc:description: A computed extrapolation of known data.

rdfs:label: Expert-annotation
dc:description: An explanatory or critical comment or other in-context information provided by an authority.

rdfs:label: Instrument-measurement
dc:description: Information obtained from a device that is used to measure material properties or make other observations.

rdfs:label: Observation
dc:description: Active acquisition of information from a primary source. Should be grouped with a label of the form AgentID_featureName.

rdfs:label: Data-value
dc:description: Designation of the type of a data item.

rdfs:label: Categorical-value
dc:description: Indicates that something can take on a limited and usually fixed number of possible values.

rdfs:label: Categorical-class-value
dc:description: Categorical values that fall into discrete classes such as true or false. The grouping is absolute in the sense that it is the same for all participants.

rdfs:label: All
dc:description: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.

rdfs:label: Correct
dc:description: Free from error. Especially conforming to fact or truth.

rdfs:label: Explicit
dc:description: Stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion or doubt.

rdfs:label: False
dc:description: Not in accordance with facts, reality or definitive criteria.

rdfs:label: Implicit
dc:description: Implied though not plainly expressed.

rdfs:label: Invalid
dc:description: Not allowed or not conforming to the correct format or specifications.

rdfs:label: None
dc:description: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

rdfs:label: Some
dc:description: At least a small amount or number of, but not a large amount of, or often.

rdfs:label: True
dc:description: Conforming to facts, reality or definitive criteria.

rdfs:label: Valid
dc:description: Allowable, usable, or acceptable.

rdfs:label: Wrong
dc:description: Inaccurate or not correct.

rdfs:label: Categorical-judgment-value
dc:description: Categorical values that are based on the judgment or perception of the participant such familiar and famous.

rdfs:label: Abnormal
dc:description: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

rdfs:label: Asymmetrical
dc:description: Lacking symmetry or having parts that fail to correspond to one another in shape, size, or arrangement.

rdfs:label: Audible
dc:description: A sound that can be perceived by the participant.

rdfs:label: Complex
dc:description: Hard, involved or complicated, elaborate, having many parts.

rdfs:label: Congruent
dc:description: Concordance of multiple evidence lines. In agreement or harmony.

rdfs:label: Constrained
dc:description: Keeping something within particular limits or bounds.

rdfs:label: Disordered
dc:description: Not neatly arranged. Confused and untidy. A structural quality in which the parts of an object are non-rigid.

rdfs:label: Familiar
dc:description: Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.

rdfs:label: Famous
dc:description: A person who has a high degree of recognition by the general population for his or her success or accomplishments. A famous person.

rdfs:label: Inaudible
dc:description: A sound below the threshold of perception of the participant.

rdfs:label: Incongruent
dc:description: Not in agreement or harmony.

rdfs:label: Involuntary
dc:description: An action that is not made by choice. In the body, involuntary actions (such as blushing) occur automatically, and cannot be controlled by choice.

rdfs:label: Masked
dc:description: Information exists but is not provided or is partially obscured due to security,  privacy, or other concerns.

rdfs:label: Normal
dc:description: Being approximately average or within certain limits. Conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

rdfs:label: Ordered
dc:description: Conforming to a logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements.

rdfs:label: Simple
dc:description: Easily understood or presenting no difficulties.

rdfs:label: Symmetrical
dc:description: Made up of exactly similar parts facing each other or around an axis. Showing aspects of symmetry.

rdfs:label: Unconstrained
dc:description: Moving without restriction.

rdfs:label: Unfamiliar
dc:description: Not having knowledge or experience of.

rdfs:label: Unmasked
dc:description: Information is revealed.

rdfs:label: Voluntary
dc:description: Using free will or design; not forced or compelled; controlled by individual volition.

rdfs:label: Categorical-level-value
dc:description: Categorical values based on dividing a continuous variable into levels such as high and low.

rdfs:label: Cold
dc:description: Having an absence of heat.

rdfs:label: Deep
dc:description: Extending relatively far inward or downward.

rdfs:label: High
dc:description: Having a greater than normal degree, intensity, or amount.

rdfs:label: Hot
dc:description: Having an excess of heat.

rdfs:label: Large
dc:description: Having a great extent such as in physical dimensions, period of time, amplitude or frequency.

rdfs:label: Liminal
dc:description: Situated at a sensory threshold that is barely perceptible or capable of eliciting a response.

rdfs:label: Loud
dc:description: Having a perceived high intensity of sound.

rdfs:label: Low
dc:description: Less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.

rdfs:label: Medium
dc:description: Mid-way between small and large in number, quantity, magnitude or extent.

rdfs:label: Negative
dc:description: Involving disadvantage or harm.

rdfs:label: Positive
dc:description: Involving advantage or good.

rdfs:label: Quiet
dc:description: Characterizing a perceived low intensity of sound.

rdfs:label: Rough
dc:description: Having a surface with perceptible bumps, ridges, or irregularities.

rdfs:label: Shallow
dc:description: Having a depth which is relatively low.

rdfs:label: Small
dc:description: Having a small extent such as in physical dimensions, period of time, amplitude or frequency.

rdfs:label: Smooth
dc:description: Having a surface free from bumps, ridges, or irregularities.

rdfs:label: Subliminal
dc:description: Situated below a sensory threshold that is imperceptible or not capable of eliciting a response.

rdfs:label: Supraliminal
dc:description: Situated above a sensory threshold that is perceptible or capable of eliciting a response.

rdfs:label: Thick
dc:description: Wide in width, extent or cross-section.

rdfs:label: Thin
dc:description: Narrow in width, extent or cross-section.

rdfs:label: Categorical-orientation-value
dc:description: Value indicating the orientation or direction of something.

rdfs:label: Backward
dc:description: Directed behind or to the rear.

rdfs:label: Downward
dc:description: Moving or leading toward a lower place or level.

rdfs:label: Forward
dc:description: At or near or directed toward the front.

rdfs:label: Horizontally-oriented
dc:description: Oriented parallel to or in the plane of the horizon.

rdfs:label: Leftward
dc:description: Going toward or facing the left.

rdfs:label: Oblique
dc:description: Slanting or inclined in direction, course, or position that is neither parallel nor perpendicular nor right-angular.

rdfs:label: Rightward
dc:description: Going toward or situated on the right.

rdfs:label: Rotated
dc:description: Positioned offset around an axis or center.

rdfs:label: Upward
dc:description: Moving, pointing, or leading to a higher place, point, or level.

rdfs:label: Vertically-oriented
dc:description: Oriented perpendicular to the plane of the horizon.

rdfs:label: Physical-value
dc:description: The value of some physical property of something.

rdfs:label: Temperature
dc:description: A measure of hot or cold based on the average kinetic energy of the atoms or molecules in the system.

rdfs:label: Weight
dc:description: The relative mass or the quantity of matter contained by something.

rdfs:label: Quantitative-value
dc:description: Something capable of being estimated or expressed with numeric values.

rdfs:label: Fraction
dc:description: A numerical value between 0 and 1.

rdfs:label: Item-count
dc:description: The integer count of something which is usually grouped with the entity it is counting. (Item-count/3, A) indicates that 3 of A have occurred up to this point.

rdfs:label: Item-index
dc:description: The index of an item in a collection, sequence or other structure. (A (Item-index/3, B)) means that A is item number 3 in B.

rdfs:label: Item-interval
dc:description: An integer indicating how many items or entities have passed since the last one of these. An item interval of 0 indicates the current item.

rdfs:label: Percentage
dc:description: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

rdfs:label: Ratio
dc:description: A quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

rdfs:label: Spatiotemporal-value
dc:description: A property relating to space and/or time.

rdfs:label: Rate-of-change
dc:description: The amount of change accumulated per unit time.

rdfs:label: Acceleration
dc:description: Magnitude of the rate of change in either speed or direction. The direction of change should be given separately.

rdfs:label: Frequency
dc:description: Frequency is the number of occurrences of a repeating event per unit time.

rdfs:label: Jerk-rate
dc:description: Magnitude of the rate at which the acceleration of an object changes with respect to time. The direction of change should be given separately.

rdfs:label: Refresh-rate
dc:description: The frequency with which the image on a computer monitor or similar electronic display screen is refreshed, usually expressed in hertz.

rdfs:label: Sampling-rate
dc:description: The number of digital samples taken or recorded per unit of time.

rdfs:label: Speed
dc:description: A scalar measure of the rate of movement of the object expressed either as the distance travelled divided by the time taken (average speed) or the rate of change of position with respect to time at a particular point (instantaneous speed). The direction of change should be given separately.

rdfs:label: Temporal-rate
dc:description: The number of items per unit of time.

rdfs:label: Spatial-value
dc:description: Value of an item involving space.

rdfs:label: Angle
dc:description: The amount of inclination of one line to another or the plane of one object to another.

rdfs:label: Distance
dc:description: A measure of the space separating two objects or points.

rdfs:label: Position
dc:description: A reference to the alignment of an object, a particular situation or view of a situation, or the location of an object. Coordinates with respect a specified frame of reference or the default Screen-frame if no frame is given.

rdfs:label: X-position
dc:description: The position along the x-axis of the frame of reference.

rdfs:label: Y-position
dc:description: The position along the y-axis of the frame of reference.

rdfs:label: Z-position
dc:description: The position along the z-axis of the frame of reference.

rdfs:label: Size
dc:description: The physical magnitude of something.

rdfs:label: Area
dc:description: The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

rdfs:label: Depth
dc:description: The distance from the surface of something especially from the perspective of looking from the front.

rdfs:label: Height
dc:description: The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object.

rdfs:label: Length
dc:description: The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.

rdfs:label: Volume
dc:description: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

rdfs:label: Width
dc:description: The extent or measurement of something from side to side.

rdfs:label: Temporal-value
dc:description: A characteristic of or relating to time or limited by time.

rdfs:label: Delay
dc:description: The time at which an event start time is delayed from the current onset time. This tag defines the start time of an event of temporal extent and may be used with the Duration tag.

rdfs:label: Duration
dc:description: The period of time during which an event occurs. This tag defines the end time of an event of temporal extent and may be used with the Delay tag.

rdfs:label: Time-interval
dc:description: The period of time separating two instances, events, or occurrences.

rdfs:label: Time-value
dc:description: A value with units of time. Usually grouped with tags identifying what the value represents.

rdfs:label: Statistical-value
dc:description: A value based on or employing the principles of statistics.

rdfs:label: Data-maximum
dc:description: The largest possible quantity or degree.

rdfs:label: Data-mean
dc:description: The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.

rdfs:label: Data-median
dc:description: The value which has an equal number of values greater and less than it.

rdfs:label: Data-minimum
dc:description: The smallest possible quantity.

rdfs:label: Probability
dc:description: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.

rdfs:label: Standard-deviation
dc:description: A measure of the range of values in a set of numbers. Standard deviation is a statistic used as a measure of the dispersion or variation in a distribution, equal to the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviations from the arithmetic mean.

rdfs:label: Statistical-accuracy
dc:description: A measure of closeness to true value expressed as a number between 0 and 1.

rdfs:label: Statistical-precision
dc:description: A quantitative representation of the degree of accuracy necessary for or associated with a particular action.

rdfs:label: Statistical-recall
dc:description: Sensitivity is a measurement datum qualifying a binary classification test and is computed by substracting the false negative rate to the integral numeral 1.

rdfs:label: Statistical-uncertainty
dc:description: A measure of the inherent variability of repeated observation measurements of a quantity including quantities evaluated by statistical methods and by other means.

rdfs:label: Data-variability-attribute
dc:description: An attribute describing how something changes or varies.

rdfs:label: Abrupt
dc:description: Marked by sudden change.

rdfs:label: Constant
dc:description: Continually recurring or continuing without interruption. Not changing in time or space.

rdfs:label: Continuous
dc:description: Uninterrupted in time, sequence, substance, or extent.

rdfs:label: Decreasing
dc:description: Becoming smaller or fewer in size, amount, intensity, or degree.

rdfs:label: Deterministic
dc:description: No randomness is involved in the development of the future states of the element.

rdfs:label: Discontinuous
dc:description: Having a gap in time, sequence, substance, or extent.

rdfs:label: Discrete
dc:description: Constituting a separate entities or parts.

rdfs:label: Estimated-value
dc:description: Something that has been calculated or measured approximately.

rdfs:label: Exact-value
dc:description: A value that is viewed to the true value according to some standard.

rdfs:label: Flickering
dc:description: Moving irregularly or unsteadily or burning or shining fitfully or with a fluctuating light.

rdfs:label: Fractal
dc:description: Having extremely irregular curves or shapes for which any suitably chosen part is similar in shape to a given larger or smaller part when magnified or reduced to the same size.

rdfs:label: Increasing
dc:description: Becoming greater in size, amount, or degree.

rdfs:label: Random
dc:description: Governed by or depending on chance. Lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.

rdfs:label: Repetitive
dc:description: A recurring action that is often non-purposeful.

rdfs:label: Stochastic
dc:description: Uses  a random probability distribution or pattern that may be analysed statistically but may not be predicted precisely to determine future states.

rdfs:label: Varying
dc:description: Differing in size, amount, degree, or nature.

rdfs:label: Environmental-property
dc:description: Relating to or arising from the surroundings of an agent.

rdfs:label: Augmented-reality
dc:description: Using technology that enhances real-world experiences with computer-derived digital overlays to change some aspects of perception of the natural environment. The digital content is shown to the user through a smart device or glasses and responds to changes in the environment.

rdfs:label: Indoors
dc:description: Located inside a building or enclosure.

rdfs:label: Motion-platform
dc:description: A mechanism that creates the feelings of being in a real motion environment.

rdfs:label: Outdoors
dc:description: Any area outside a building or shelter.

rdfs:label: Real-world
dc:description: Located in a place that exists in real space and time under realistic conditions.

rdfs:label: Rural
dc:description: Of or pertaining to the country as opposed to the city.

rdfs:label: Terrain
dc:description: Characterization of the physical features of a tract of land.

rdfs:label: Composite-terrain
dc:description: Tracts of land characterized by a mixure of physical features.

rdfs:label: Dirt-terrain
dc:description: Tracts of land characterized by a soil surface and lack of vegetation.

rdfs:label: Grassy-terrain
dc:description: Tracts of land covered by grass.

rdfs:label: Gravel-terrain
dc:description: Tracts of land covered by a surface consisting a loose aggregation of small water-worn or pounded stones.

rdfs:label: Leaf-covered-terrain
dc:description: Tracts of land covered by leaves and composited organic material.

rdfs:label: Muddy-terrain
dc:description: Tracts of land covered by a liquid or semi-liquid mixture of water and some combination of soil, silt, and clay.

rdfs:label: Paved-terrain
dc:description: Tracts of land covered  with concrete, asphalt, stones, or bricks.

rdfs:label: Rocky-terrain
dc:description: Tracts of land consisting or full of rock or rocks.

rdfs:label: Sloped-terrain
dc:description: Tracts of land arranged in a sloping  or inclined position.

rdfs:label: Uneven-terrain
dc:description: Tracts of land that are not level, smooth, or regular.

rdfs:label: Urban
dc:description: Relating to, located in, or characteristic of a city or densely populated area.

rdfs:label: Virtual-world
dc:description: Using technology that creates immersive, computer-generated experiences that a person can interact with and navigate through. The digital content is generally delivered to the user through some type of headset and responds to changes in head position or through interaction with other types of sensors. Existing in a virtual setting such as a simulation or game environment.

rdfs:label: Informational-property
dc:description: Something that pertains to a task.

rdfs:label: Description
dc:description: An explanation of what the tag group it is in means. If the description is at the top-level of an event string, the description applies to the event.

rdfs:label: ID
dc:description: An alphanumeric name that identifies either a unique object or a unique class of objects. Here the object or class may be an idea, physical countable object (or class), or physical uncountable substance (or class).

rdfs:label: Label
dc:description: A string of 20 or fewer characters identifying something. Labels usually refer to general classes of things while IDs refer to specific instances. A term that is associated with some entity. A brief description given for purposes of identification. An identifying or descriptive marker that is attached to an object.

rdfs:label: Metadata
dc:description: Data about data. Information that describes another set of data.

rdfs:label: CogAtlas
dc:description: The Cognitive Atlas ID number of something.

rdfs:label: CogPo
dc:description: The CogPO ID number of something.

rdfs:label: Creation-date
dc:description: The date on which data creation of this element began.

rdfs:label: Experimental-note
dc:description: A brief written record about the experiment.

rdfs:label: Library-name
dc:description: Official name of a HED library.

rdfs:label: OBO-identifier
dc:description: The identifier of a term in some Open Biology Ontology (OBO) ontology.

rdfs:label: Pathname
dc:description: The specification of a node (file or directory) in a hierarchical file system, usually specified by listing the nodes top-down.

rdfs:label: Subject-identifier
dc:description: A sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize a trial or study subject.

rdfs:label: Version-identifier
dc:description: An alphanumeric character string that identifies a form or variant of a type or original.

rdfs:label: Version-identifier-#
dc:description: Usually is a semantic version.

rdfs:label: Parameter
dc:description: Something user-defined for this experiment.

rdfs:label: Parameter-label
dc:description: The name of the parameter.

rdfs:label: Parameter-value
dc:description: The value of the parameter.

rdfs:label: Organizational-property
dc:description: Relating to an organization or the action of organizing something.

rdfs:label: Collection
dc:description: A tag designating a grouping of items such as in a set or list.

rdfs:label: Collection-#
dc:description: Name of the collection.

rdfs:label: Condition-variable
dc:description: An aspect of the experiment or task that is to be varied during the experiment. Task-conditions are sometimes called independent variables or contrasts.

rdfs:label: Condition-variable-#
dc:description: Name of the condition variable.

rdfs:label: Control-variable
dc:description: An aspect of the experiment that is fixed throughout the study and usually is explicitly controlled.

rdfs:label: Control-variable-#
dc:description: Name of the control variable.

rdfs:label: Def
dc:description: A HED-specific utility tag used with a defined name to represent the tags associated with that definition.

rdfs:label: Def-#
dc:description: Name of the definition.

rdfs:label: Def-expand
dc:description: A HED specific utility tag that is grouped with an expanded definition. The child value of the Def-expand is the name of the expanded definition.

rdfs:label: Definition
dc:description: A HED-specific utility tag whose child value is the name of the concept and the tag group associated with the tag is an English language explanation of a concept.

rdfs:label: Definition-#
dc:description: Name of the definition.

rdfs:label: Event-context
dc:description: A special HED tag inserted as part of a top-level tag group to contain information about the interrelated conditions under which the event occurs. The event context includes information about other events that are ongoing when this event happens.

rdfs:label: Event-stream
dc:description: A special HED tag indicating that this event is a member of an ordered succession of events.

rdfs:label: Event-stream-#
dc:description: Name of the event stream.

rdfs:label: Experimental-intertrial
dc:description: A tag used to indicate a part of the experiment between trials usually where nothing is happening.

rdfs:label: Experimental-intertrial-#
dc:description: Optional label for the intertrial block.

rdfs:label: Experimental-trial
dc:description: Designates a run or execution of an activity, for example, one execution of a script. A tag used to indicate a particular organizational part in the experimental design often containing a stimulus-response pair or stimulus-response-feedback triad.

rdfs:label: Experimental-trial-#
dc:description: Optional label for the trial (often a numerical string).

rdfs:label: Indicator-variable
dc:description: An aspect of the experiment or task that is measured as task conditions are varied during the experiment. Experiment indicators are sometimes called dependent variables.

rdfs:label: Indicator-variable-#
dc:description: Name of the indicator variable.

rdfs:label: Recording
dc:description: A tag designating the data recording. Recording tags are usually have temporal scope which is the entire recording.

rdfs:label: Recording-#
dc:description: Optional label for the recording.

rdfs:label: Task
dc:description: An assigned piece of work, usually with a time allotment. A tag used to indicate a linkage the structured activities performed as part of the experiment.

rdfs:label: Task-#
dc:description: Optional label for the task block.

rdfs:label: Time-block
dc:description: A tag used to indicate a contiguous time block in the experiment during which something is fixed or noted.

rdfs:label: Time-block-#
dc:description: Optional label for the task block.

rdfs:label: Sensory-property
dc:description: Relating to sensation or the physical senses.

rdfs:label: Sensory-attribute
dc:description: A sensory characteristic associated with another entity.

rdfs:label: Auditory-attribute
dc:description: Pertaining to the sense of hearing.

rdfs:label: Loudness
dc:description: Perceived intensity of a sound.

rdfs:label: Pitch
dc:description: A perceptual property that allows the user to order sounds on a frequency scale.

rdfs:label: Sound-envelope
dc:description: Description of how a sound changes over time.

rdfs:label: Sound-envelope-attack
dc:description: The time taken for initial run-up of level from nil to peak usually beginning when the key on a musical instrument is pressed.

rdfs:label: Sound-envelope-decay
dc:description: The time taken for the subsequent run down from the attack level to the designated sustain level.

rdfs:label: Sound-envelope-release
dc:description: The time taken for the level to decay from the sustain level to zero after the key is released.

rdfs:label: Sound-envelope-sustain
dc:description: The time taken for the main sequence of the sound duration, until the key is released.

rdfs:label: Sound-volume
dc:description: The sound pressure level (SPL) usually the ratio to a reference signal estimated as the lower bound of hearing.

rdfs:label: Timbre
dc:description: The perceived sound quality of a singing voice or musical instrument.

rdfs:label: Gustatory-attribute
dc:description: Pertaining to the sense of taste.

rdfs:label: Bitter
dc:description: Having a sharp, pungent taste.

rdfs:label: Salty
dc:description: Tasting of or like salt.

rdfs:label: Savory
dc:description: Belonging to a taste that is salty or spicy rather than sweet.

rdfs:label: Sour
dc:description: Having a sharp, acidic taste.

rdfs:label: Sweet
dc:description: Having or resembling the taste of sugar.

rdfs:label: Olfactory-attribute
dc:description: Having a smell.

rdfs:label: Somatic-attribute
dc:description: Pertaining to the feelings in the body or of the nervous system.

rdfs:label: Pain
dc:description: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

rdfs:label: Stress
dc:description: The negative mental, emotional, and physical reactions that occur when environmental stressors are perceived as exceeding the adaptive capacities of the individual.

rdfs:label: Tactile-attribute
dc:description: Pertaining to the sense of touch.

rdfs:label: Tactile-pressure
dc:description: Having a feeling of heaviness.

rdfs:label: Tactile-temperature
dc:description: Having a feeling of hotness or coldness.

rdfs:label: Tactile-texture
dc:description: Having a feeling of roughness.

rdfs:label: Tactile-vibration
dc:description: Having a feeling of mechanical oscillation.

rdfs:label: Vestibular-attribute
dc:description: Pertaining to the sense of balance or body position.

rdfs:label: Visual-attribute
dc:description: Pertaining to the sense of sight.

rdfs:label: Color
dc:description: The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.
