rdfs:label: Color-shade
dc:description: A slight degree of difference between colors, especially with regard to how light or dark it is or as distinguished from one nearly like it.

rdfs:label: Dark-shade
dc:description: A color tone not reflecting much light.

rdfs:label: Light-shade
dc:description: A color tone reflecting more light.

rdfs:label: Grayscale
dc:description: Using a color map composed of shades of gray, varying from black at the weakest intensity to white at the strongest.

rdfs:label: Grayscale-#
dc:description: White intensity between 0 and 1.

rdfs:label: HSV-color
dc:description: A color representation that models how colors appear under light.

rdfs:label: HSV-value
dc:description: An attribute of a visual sensation according to which an area appears to emit more or less light.

rdfs:label: Hue
dc:description: Attribute of a visual sensation according to which an area appears to be similar to one of the perceived colors.

rdfs:label: Hue-#
dc:description: Angular value between 0 and 360.

rdfs:label: Saturation
dc:description: Colorfulness of a stimulus relative to its own brightness.

rdfs:label: Saturation-#
dc:description: B value of RGB between 0 and 1.

rdfs:label: RGB-color
dc:description: A color from the RGB schema.

rdfs:label: RGB-blue
dc:description: The blue component.

rdfs:label: RGB-blue-#
dc:description: B value of RGB between 0 and 1.

rdfs:label: RGB-green
dc:description: The green component.

rdfs:label: RGB-green-#
dc:description: G value of RGB between 0 and 1.

rdfs:label: RGB-red
dc:description: The red component.

rdfs:label: RGB-red-#
dc:description: R value of RGB between 0 and 1.

rdfs:label: Luminance
dc:description: A quality that exists by virtue of the luminous intensity per unit area projected in a given direction.

rdfs:label: Opacity
dc:description: A measure of impenetrability to light.

rdfs:label: Sensory-presentation
dc:description: The entity has a sensory manifestation.

rdfs:label: Auditory-presentation
dc:description: The sense of hearing is used in the presentation to the user.

rdfs:label: Loudspeaker-separation
dc:description: The distance between two loudspeakers. Grouped with the Distance tag.

rdfs:label: Monophonic
dc:description: Relating to sound transmission, recording, or reproduction involving a single transmission path.

rdfs:label: Silent
dc:description: The absence of ambient audible sound or the state of having ceased to produce sounds.

rdfs:label: Stereophonic
dc:description: Relating to, or constituting sound reproduction involving the use of separated microphones and two transmission channels to achieve the sound separation of a live hearing.

rdfs:label: Gustatory-presentation
dc:description: The sense of taste used in the presentation to the user.

rdfs:label: Olfactory-presentation
dc:description: The sense of smell used in the presentation to the user.

rdfs:label: Somatic-presentation
dc:description: The nervous system is used in the presentation to the user.

rdfs:label: Tactile-presentation
dc:description: The sense of touch used in the presentation to the user.

rdfs:label: Vestibular-presentation
dc:description: The sense balance used in the presentation to the user.

rdfs:label: Visual-presentation
dc:description: The sense of sight used in the presentation to the user.

rdfs:label: 2D-view
dc:description: A view showing only two dimensions.

rdfs:label: 3D-view
dc:description: A view showing three dimensions.

rdfs:label: Background-view
dc:description: Parts of the view that are farthest from the viewer and usually the not part of the visual focus.

rdfs:label: Bistable-view
dc:description: Something having two stable visual forms that have two distinguishable stable forms as in optical illusions.

rdfs:label: Foreground-view
dc:description: Parts of the view that are closest to the viewer and usually the most important part of the visual focus.

rdfs:label: Foveal-view
dc:description: Visual presentation directly on the fovea. A view projected on the small depression in the retina containing only cones and where vision is most acute.

rdfs:label: Map-view
dc:description: A diagrammatic representation of an area of land or sea showing physical features, cities, roads.

rdfs:label: Aerial-view
dc:description: Elevated view of an object from above, with a perspective as though the observer were a bird.

rdfs:label: Satellite-view
dc:description: A representation as captured by technology such as a satellite.

rdfs:label: Street-view
dc:description: A 360-degrees panoramic view from a position on the ground.

rdfs:label: Peripheral-view
dc:description: Indirect vision as it occurs outside the point of fixation.

rdfs:label: Task-property
dc:description: Something that pertains to a task.

rdfs:label: Task-action-type
dc:description: How an agent action should be interpreted in terms of the task specification.

rdfs:label: Appropriate-action
dc:description: An action suitable or proper in the circumstances.

rdfs:label: Correct-action
dc:description: An action that was a correct response in the context of the task.

rdfs:label: Correction
dc:description: An action offering an improvement to replace a mistake or error.

rdfs:label: Done-indication
dc:description: An action that indicates that the participant has completed this step in the task.

rdfs:label: Imagined-action
dc:description: Form a mental image or concept of something. This is used to identity something that only happened in the imagination of the participant as in imagined movements in motor imagery paradigms.

rdfs:label: Inappropriate-action
dc:description: An action not in keeping with what is correct or proper for the task.

rdfs:label: Incorrect-action
dc:description: An action considered wrong or incorrect in the context of the task.

rdfs:label: Indeterminate-action
dc:description: An action that cannot be distinguished between two or more possibibities in the current context. This tag might be applied when an outside evaluator or a classification algorithm cannot determine a definitive result.

rdfs:label: Miss
dc:description: An action considered to be a failure in the context of the task. For example, if the agent is supposed to try to hit a target and misses.

rdfs:label: Near-miss
dc:description: An action barely satisfied the requirements of the task. In a driving experiment for example this could pertain to a narrowly avoided collision or other accident.

rdfs:label: Omitted-action
dc:description: An expected response was skipped.

rdfs:label: Ready-indication
dc:description: An action that indicates that the participant is ready to perform the next step in the task.

rdfs:label: Task-attentional-demand
dc:description: Strategy for allocating attention toward goal-relevant information.

rdfs:label: Bottom-up-attention
dc:description: Attentional guidance purely by externally driven factors to stimuli that are salient because of their inherent properties relative to the background. Sometimes this is referred to as stimulus driven.

rdfs:label: Covert-attention
dc:description: Paying attention without moving the eyes.

rdfs:label: Divided-attention
dc:description: Integrating parallel multiple stimuli. Behavior involving responding simultaneously to multiple tasks or multiple task demands.

rdfs:label: Focused-attention
dc:description: Responding discretely to specific visual, auditory, or tactile stimuli.

rdfs:label: Orienting-attention
dc:description: Directing attention to a target stimulus.

rdfs:label: Overt-attention
dc:description: Selectively processing one location over others by moving the eyes to point at that location.

rdfs:label: Selective-attention
dc:description: Maintaining a behavioral or cognitive set in the face of distracting or competing stimuli. Ability to pay attention to a limited array of all available sensory information.

rdfs:label: Sustained-attention
dc:description: Maintaining a consistent behavioral response during continuous and repetitive activity.

rdfs:label: Switched-attention
dc:description: Having to switch attention between two or more modalities of presentation.

rdfs:label: Top-down-attention
dc:description: Voluntary allocation of attention to certain features. Sometimes this is referred to goal-oriented attention.

rdfs:label: Task-effect-evidence
dc:description: The evidence supporting the conclusion that the event had the specified effect.

rdfs:label: Behavioral-evidence
dc:description: An indication or conclusion based on the behavior of an agent.

rdfs:label: Computational-evidence
dc:description: A type of evidence in which data are produced, and/or generated, and/or analyzed on a computer.

rdfs:label: External-evidence
dc:description: A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

rdfs:label: Intended-effect
dc:description: A phenomenon that is intended to follow and be caused by some previous phenomenon.

rdfs:label: Task-event-role
dc:description: The purpose of an event with respect to the task.

rdfs:label: Experimental-stimulus
dc:description: Part of something designed to elicit a response in the experiment.

rdfs:label: Incidental
dc:description: A sensory or other type of event that is unrelated to the task or experiment.

rdfs:label: Instructional
dc:description: Usually associated with a sensory event intended to give instructions to the participant about the task or behavior.

rdfs:label: Mishap
dc:description: Unplanned disruption such as an equipment or experiment control abnormality or experimenter error.

rdfs:label: Participant-response
dc:description: Something related to a participant actions in performing the task.

rdfs:label: Task-activity
dc:description: Something that is part of the overall task or is necessary to the overall experiment but is not directly part of a stimulus-response cycle. Examples would be taking a survey or provided providing a silva sample.

rdfs:label: Warning
dc:description: Something that should warn the participant that the parameters of the task have been or are about to be exceeded such as a warning message about getting too close to the shoulder of the road in a driving task.

rdfs:label: Task-relationship
dc:description: Specifying organizational importance of sub-tasks.

rdfs:label: Background-subtask
dc:description: A part of the task which should be performed in the background as for example inhibiting blinks due to instruction while performing the primary task.

rdfs:label: Primary-subtask
dc:description: A part of the task which should be the primary focus of the participant.

rdfs:label: Task-stimulus-role
dc:description: The role the stimulus plays in the task.

rdfs:label: Cue
dc:description: A signal for an action, a pattern of stimuli indicating a particular response.

rdfs:label: Distractor
dc:description: A person or thing that distracts or a plausible but incorrect option in a multiple-choice question. In pyschological studies this is sometimes referred to as a foil.

rdfs:label: Expected
dc:description: Considered likely, probable or anticipated. Something of low information value as in frequent non-targets in an RSVP paradigm.

rdfs:label: Extraneous
dc:description: Irrelevant or unrelated to the subject being dealt with.

rdfs:label: Feedback
dc:description: An evaluative response to an inquiry, process, event, or activity.

rdfs:label: Go-signal
dc:description: An indicator to proceed with a planned action.

rdfs:label: Meaningful
dc:description: Conveying significant or relevant information.

rdfs:label: Newly-learned
dc:description: Representing recently acquired information or understanding.

rdfs:label: Non-informative
dc:description: Something that is not useful in forming an opinion or judging an outcome.

rdfs:label: Non-target
dc:description: Something other than that done or looked for. Also tag Expected if the Non-target is frequent.

rdfs:label: Not-meaningful
dc:description: Not having a serious, important, or useful quality or purpose.

rdfs:label: Novel
dc:description: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel.

rdfs:label: Oddball
dc:description: Something unusual, or infrequent.

rdfs:label: Penalty
dc:description: A disadvantage, loss, or hardship due to some action.

rdfs:label: Planned
dc:description: Something that was decided on or arranged in advance.

rdfs:label: Priming
dc:description: An implicit memory effect in which exposure to a stimulus influences response to a later stimulus.

rdfs:label: Query
dc:description: A sentence of inquiry that asks for a reply.

rdfs:label: Reward
dc:description: A positive reinforcement for a desired action, behavior or response.

rdfs:label: Stop-signal
dc:description: An indicator that the agent should stop the current activity.

rdfs:label: Target
dc:description: Something fixed as a goal, destination, or point of examination.

rdfs:label: Threat
dc:description: An indicator that signifies hostility and predicts an increased probability of attack.

rdfs:label: Timed
dc:description: Something planned or scheduled to be done at a particular time or lasting for a specified amount of time.

rdfs:label: Unexpected
dc:description: Something that is not anticipated.

rdfs:label: Unplanned
dc:description: Something that has not been planned as part of the task.

rdfs:label: Relation
dc:description: Concerns the way in which two or more people or things are connected.

rdfs:label: Comparative-relation
dc:description: Something considered in comparison to something else. The first entity is the focus.

rdfs:label: Approximately-equal-to
dc:description: (A, (Approximately-equal-to, B)) indicates that A and B have almost the same value. Here A and B could refer to sizes, orders, positions or other quantities.

rdfs:label: Equal-to
dc:description: (A, (Equal-to, B)) indicates that the size or order of A is the same as that of B.

rdfs:label: Greater-than
dc:description: (A, (Greater-than, B)) indicates that the relative size or order of A is bigger than that of B.

rdfs:label: Greater-than-or-equal-to
dc:description: (A, (Greater-than-or-equal-to, B)) indicates that the relative size or order of A is bigger than or the same as that of B.

rdfs:label: Less-than
dc:description: (A, (Less-than, B)) indicates that A is smaller than B. Here A and B could refer to sizes, orders, positions or other quantities.

rdfs:label: Less-than-or-equal-to
dc:description: (A, (Less-than-or-equal-to, B)) indicates that the relative size or order of A is smaller than or equal to B.

rdfs:label: Not-equal-to
dc:description: (A, (Not-equal-to, B)) indicates that the size or order of A is not the same as that of B.

rdfs:label: Connective-relation
dc:description: Indicates two entities are related in some way. The first entity is the focus.

rdfs:label: Belongs-to
dc:description: (A, (Belongs-to, B)) indicates that A is a member of B.

rdfs:label: Connected-to
dc:description: (A, (Connected-to, B)) indicates that A is related to B in some respect, usually through a direct link.

rdfs:label: Contained-in
dc:description: (A, (Contained-in, B)) indicates that A is completely inside of B.

rdfs:label: Described-by
dc:description: (A, (Described-by, B)) indicates that B provides information about A.

rdfs:label: From-to
dc:description: (A, (From-to, B)) indicates a directional relation from A to B. A is considered the source.

rdfs:label: Group-of
dc:description: (A, (Group-of, B)) indicates A is a group of items of type B.

rdfs:label: Implied-by
dc:description: (A, (Implied-by, B)) indicates B is suggested by A.

rdfs:label: Includes
dc:description: (A, (Includes, B)) indicates that A has B as a member or part.

rdfs:label: Interacts-with
dc:description: (A, (Interacts-with, B)) indicates A and B interact, possibly reciprocally.

rdfs:label: Member-of
dc:description: (A, (Member-of, B)) indicates A is a member of group B.

rdfs:label: Part-of
dc:description: (A, (Part-of, B)) indicates A is a part of the whole B.

rdfs:label: Performed-by
dc:description: (A, (Performed-by, B)) indicates that the action or procedure A was carried out by agent B.

rdfs:label: Performed-using
dc:description: (A, (Performed-using, B)) indicates that the action or procedure A was accomplished using B.

rdfs:label: Related-to
dc:description: (A, (Related-to, B)) indicates A has some relationship to B.

rdfs:label: Unrelated-to
dc:description: (A, (Unrelated-to, B)) indicates that A is not related to B.  For example, A is not related to Task.

rdfs:label: Directional-relation
dc:description: A relationship indicating direction of change of one entity relative to another. The first entity is the focus.

rdfs:label: Away-from
dc:description: (A, (Away-from, B)) indicates that A is going or has moved away from B. The meaning depends on A and B.

rdfs:label: Towards
dc:description: (A, (Towards, B)) indicates that A is going to or has moved to B. The meaning depends on A and B.

rdfs:label: Logical-relation
dc:description: Indicating a logical relationship between entities. The first entity is usually the focus.

rdfs:label: And
dc:description: (A, (And, B)) means A and B are both in effect.

rdfs:label: Or
dc:description: (A, (Or, B)) means at least one of A and B are in effect.

rdfs:label: Spatial-relation
dc:description: Indicating a relationship about position between entities.

rdfs:label: Above
dc:description: (A, (Above, B)) means A is in a place or position that is higher than B.

rdfs:label: Across-from
dc:description: (A, (Across-from, B)) means A is on the opposite side of something from B.

rdfs:label: Adjacent-to
dc:description: (A, (Adjacent-to, B)) indicates that A is next to B in time or space.

rdfs:label: Ahead-of
dc:description: (A, (Ahead-of, B)) indicates that A is further forward in time or space in B.

rdfs:label: Around
dc:description: (A, (Around, B)) means A is in or near the present place or situation of B.

rdfs:label: Behind
dc:description: (A, (Behind, B)) means A is at or to the far side of B, typically so as to be hidden by it.

rdfs:label: Below
dc:description: (A, (Below, B)) means A is in a place or position that is lower than the position of B.

rdfs:label: Between
dc:description: (A, (Between, (B, C))) means A is in the space or interval separating B and C.

rdfs:label: Bilateral-to
dc:description: (A, (Bilateral, B)) means A is on both sides of B or affects both sides of B.

rdfs:label: Bottom-edge-of
dc:description: (A, (Bottom-edge-of, B)) means A is on the bottom most part or or near the boundary of B.

rdfs:label: Boundary-of
dc:description: (A, (Boundary-of, B)) means A is on or part of the edge or boundary of B.

rdfs:label: Center-of
dc:description: (A, (Center-of, B)) means A is at a point or or in an area that is approximately central within B.

rdfs:label: Close-to
dc:description: (A, (Close-to, B)) means A is at a small distance from or is located near in space to B.

rdfs:label: Far-from
dc:description: (A, (Far-from, B)) means A is at a large distance from or is not located near in space to B.

rdfs:label: In-front-of
dc:description: (A, (In-front-of, B)) means A is in a position just ahead or at the front part of B, potentially partially blocking B from view.

rdfs:label: Left-edge-of
dc:description: (A, (Left-edge-of, B)) means A is located on the left side of B on or near the boundary of B.

rdfs:label: Left-side-of
dc:description: (A, (Left-side-of, B)) means A is located on the left side of B usually as part of B.

rdfs:label: Lower-center-of
dc:description: (A, (Lower-center-of, B)) means A is situated on the lower center part of B (due south). This relation is often used to specify qualitative information about screen position.

rdfs:label: Lower-left-of
Attributes: relatedTag=Center-of, relatedTag=Lower-center-of, relatedTag=Lower-right-of, relatedTag=Upper-center-of, relatedTag=Upper-left-of, relatedTag=Upper-right-of
dc:description: (A, (Lower-left-of, B)) means A is situated on the lower left part of B. This relation is often used to specify qualitative information about screen position.

rdfs:label: Lower-right-of
Attributes: relatedTag=Center-of, relatedTag=Lower-center-of, relatedTag=Lower-left-of, relatedTag=Upper-left-of, relatedTag=Upper-center-of, relatedTag=Upper-left-of, relatedTag=Lower-right-of
dc:description: (A, (Lower-right-of, B)) means A is situated on the lower right part of B. This relation is often used to specify qualitative information about screen position.

rdfs:label: Outside-of
dc:description: (A, (Outside-of, B)) means A is located in the space around but not including B.

rdfs:label: Over
dc:description: (A, (Over, B)) means A above is above B so as to cover or protect or A extends over the a general area as from a from a vantage point.

rdfs:label: Right-edge-of
dc:description: (A, (Right-edge-of, B)) means A is located on the right side of B on or near the boundary of B.

rdfs:label: Right-side-of
dc:description: (A, (Right-side-of, B)) means A is located on the right side of B usually as part of B.

rdfs:label: To-left-of
dc:description: (A, (To-left-of, B)) means A is located on or directed toward the side to the west of B when B is facing north. This term is used when A is not part of B.

rdfs:label: To-right-of
dc:description: (A, (To-right-of, B)) means A is located on or directed toward the side to the east of B when B is facing north. This term is used when A is not part of B.

rdfs:label: Top-edge-of
dc:description: (A, (Top-edge-of, B)) means A is on the uppermost part or or near the boundary of B.

rdfs:label: Top-of
dc:description: (A, (Top-of, B)) means A is on the uppermost part, side, or surface of B.

rdfs:label: Underneath
dc:description: (A, (Underneath, B)) means A is situated directly below and may be concealed by B.

rdfs:label: Upper-center-of
Attributes: relatedTag=Center-of, relatedTag=Lower-center-of, relatedTag=Lower-left-of, relatedTag=Lower-right-of, relatedTag=Upper-center-of, relatedTag=Upper-right-of
dc:description: (A, (Upper-center-of, B)) means A is situated on the upper center part of B (due north). This relation is often used to specify qualitative information about screen position.

rdfs:label: Upper-left-of
Attributes: relatedTag=Center-of, relatedTag=Lower-center-of, relatedTag=Lower-left-of, relatedTag=Lower-right-of, relatedTag=Upper-center-of, relatedTag=Upper-right-of
dc:description: (A, (Upper-left-of, B)) means A is situated on the upper left part of B. This relation is often used to specify qualitative information about screen position.

rdfs:label: Upper-right-of
Attributes: relatedTag=Center-of, relatedTag=Lower-center-of, relatedTag=Lower-left-of, relatedTag=Upper-left-of, relatedTag=Upper-center-of, relatedTag=Lower-right-of
dc:description: (A, (Upper-right-of, B)) means A is situated on the upper right part of B. This relation is often used to specify qualitative information about screen position.

rdfs:label: Within
dc:description: (A, (Within, B)) means A is on the inside of or contained in B.

rdfs:label: Temporal-relation
dc:description: A relationship that includes a temporal or time-based component.

rdfs:label: After
dc:description: (A, (After B)) means A happens at a time subsequent to a reference time related to B.

rdfs:label: Asynchronous-with
dc:description: (A, (Asynchronous-with, B)) means A happens at times not occurring at the same time or having the same period or phase as B.

rdfs:label: Before
dc:description: (A, (Before B)) means A happens at a time earlier in time or order than B.

rdfs:label: During
dc:description: (A, (During, B)) means A happens at some point in a given period of time in which B is ongoing.

rdfs:label: Synchronous-with
dc:description: (A, (Synchronous-with, B)) means A happens at occurs at the same time or rate as B.

rdfs:label: Waiting-for
dc:description: (A, (Waiting-for, B)) means A pauses for something to happen in B.
